metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9087 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Integer underflow in the ksba_oid_to_str function in Libksba before 1.3.2,as used in GnuPG, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(crash) via a crafted OID in a (1) S/MIME message or (2) ECC based OpenPGPdata, which triggers a buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9087` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libksba8 - 1.3.0-3ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libksba package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.0-3ubuntu0.14.04.1').
